org.lemming.utils

Interface FitFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Gaussian2DFunction

    public interface FitFunction
    Interface for a fitting function
    Author:
    jborbely

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deriv(double[][] x, double[] p, double[][] der)
      The analytical form of the partial derivatives of the fitting function, for nD data.
      void deriv(double[] x, double[] p, double[][] der)
      The analytical form of the partial derivatives of the fitting function, for 1D data.
      void fcn(double[][] x, double[] p, double[] y)
      The fitting function, for nD data.
      void fcn(double[] x, double[] p, double[] y)
      The fitting function, for 1D data.
      void finalCheck(double[][] x, double[] y, double[] p)
      Final check (for nD data) to ensure that the best-guess parameters from the fit make sense or if you want to force a parameter to be within a certain range (e.g., if one of the fitting parameters is an angle and its final best-guess value is not between -π and π you can correct for its value to be within this range by adding/subtracting 2πn).
      void finalCheck(double[] x, double[] y, double[] p)
      Final check (for 1D data) to ensure that the best-guess parameters from the fit make sense or if you want to force a parameter to be within a certain range (e.g., if one of the fitting parameters is an angle and its final best-guess value is not between -π and π you can correct for its value to be within this range by adding/subtracting 2πn).
      void pCheck(double[] p, double[] pInitial)
      Checks to ensure that none of the fit parameters get an unrealistic (unwanted) value.

    • Method Detail

      • fcn

        void fcn(double[][] x,
         double[] p,
         double[] y)
        The fitting function, for nD data.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters
        y - - a list that is holding the y values (the value of the function evaluated at each x value). Does an in-place replacement of the value in y evaluated at each x value in order to avoid creating a new double[] y array on every method call from the fitting routine.

      • fcn

        void fcn(double[] x,
         double[] p,
         double[] y)
        The fitting function, for 1D data.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters
        y - - a list that is holding the y values (the value of the function evaluated at each x value). Does an in-place replacement of the value in y evaluated at each x value in order to avoid creating a new double[] y array on every method call from the fitting routine.

      • deriv

        void deriv(double[][] x,
           double[] p,
           double[][] der)
        The analytical form of the partial derivatives of the fitting function, for nD data.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters
        der - - a p.length by y.length array that is holding the values of the partial derivatives for each parameter that is evaluated at each x value. Does an in-place replacement of the value in der evaluated for each parameter and at each x value in order to avoid creating a new double[][] der array on every method call from the fitting routine.

      • deriv

        void deriv(double[] x,
           double[] p,
           double[][] der)
        The analytical form of the partial derivatives of the fitting function, for 1D data.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters
        der - - a p.length by y.length array that is holding the values of the partial derivatives for each parameter that is evaluated at each x value. Does an in-place replacement of the value in der evaluated for each parameter and at each x value in order to avoid creating a new double[][] der array on every method call from the fitting routine.

      • finalCheck

        void finalCheck(double[][] x,
                double[] y,
                double[] p)
        Final check (for nD data) to ensure that the best-guess parameters from the fit make sense or if you want to force a parameter to be within a certain range (e.g., if one of the fitting parameters is an angle and its final best-guess value is not between -π and π you can correct for its value to be within this range by adding/subtracting 2πn).

        You can specify code in this method to modify the values in p. If you don't want to modify p in any way or if your data set has dimension = 1 then you can just ignore this method.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        y - - the y values (the dependent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters.

      • finalCheck

        void finalCheck(double[] x,
                double[] y,
                double[] p)
        Final check (for 1D data) to ensure that the best-guess parameters from the fit make sense or if you want to force a parameter to be within a certain range (e.g., if one of the fitting parameters is an angle and its final best-guess value is not between -π and π you can correct for its value to be within this range by adding/subtracting 2πn).

        You can specify code in this method to modify the values in p. If you don't want to modify p in any way or if your data set has dimensions greater than 1 then you can just ignore this method.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x values (the independent variable)
        y - - the y values (the dependent variable)
        p - - the values of the function parameters.

      • pCheck

        void pCheck(double[] p,
            double[] pInitial)
        Checks to ensure that none of the fit parameters get an unrealistic (unwanted) value. If a parameter value does start to converge to an unrealistic (unwanted) value then it can either be set back to its initial-guess value or modified in another way (e.g., if one of the fitting parameters is the amplitude of a cosine function and you want its value to always be positive so that you don't have to worry about applying π phase shifts to compensate for a negative amplitude)
        Parameters:
        p - - the current values of the function parameters. You can specify code in this method to replace unrealistic(unwanted) values by the appropriate values specified by you. If you don't want to modify p in any way then you can just ignore this method.
        pInitial - - the initial guess of the parameters
